USDA has announced that they have (limited) funds to allow us to continue the Summer Food Service Program through December 31st or until funds run out...whichever comes first.

Beginning tomorrow, September 4th, ALL STUDENTS regardless of meal status will be eligible for FREE Breakfast and Lunch until the funds are no longer available.

This is open to any child ages 1 -18, however, all buildings with the exception of the high school will be serving only their enrolled students. Families that would like to pick up meals for children not enrolled at USD 257 ages 1 -18 may pick up meals at the high school only. From 11:30-12:30 (11:00-11:45 on Wednesdays)

Once funding runs out we will revert back to our normal meal procedures.

If you have money on Powerschool for meals, they will transfer and still be available when the FREE USDA meal funding is exhausted.

USD 257-Iola understands that family health situations are varied and unique. Parents may choose between two options for learning this year, on-site or remote learning. Important details of each are on the attached document to help families make the best decision for them. Should schools need to be closed for a period of time, on-site students will be taught remotely and will follow the Remote Learning protocols. Regardless of the option chosen, teachers, staff, and administrators are committed to providing an exceptional educational experience for all.

We know there have been lots of questions and concerns regarding school this next year. We are committed to answering your questions as soon as we have information available to share. Feel free to email questions to newsletter@usd257.org and we will begin posting answers to the most frequently asked questions.

As with every year, we are excited to begin the school year and look forward to working with each family to make learning the best possible during these uncertain times!
